alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 3:04PM MST until August 14 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 304 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Witch Well, Petrified Forest National Park, Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters, Zion Reservoir and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 310 and 328. Highway 191 161 between mile markers 321 and 356. State Route 61 between mile markers 417 and 426. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Carrizo Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Big Hollow Wash, Zu√±i River, Wildhorse Wash, Ninemile Wash, Crazy Creek, Digger Wash, Hardscrabble Wash, Bidahochi Wash, Beaver Dam Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Jaralosa Draw, Dead Wash, Dry Creek, Jarvis Wash, Seven Springs Wash, Leroux Wash, Morgan Canyon, Puerco River, Zuqi River, Milky Wash, Sabito Wash and Little Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
